name: Holiday Inn Express Savannah-Historic District

reviews.text: What a great location. Room was clean and comfortable. The BEST part was Becki in the tavern, She knew everyone and everything to do! I travel here often and will stay here EVERY time. Thank you!!!!
reviews.title: Great location and AWESOME Staff especially Becki!!!!!

reviews.text: My husband attended a convention in Savannah in August, and we stayed at this very comfortable, very convenient hotel for 6 days. The experience couldn't have been better. The free breakfast was really good -- much tastier and more substantial than a continental breakfast, and the dining area had plenty of room. We didn't use the pool, so I can't comment on that (although it was on the roof, and the views from up there were spectacular). The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, the wi-fi worked well, and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I loved the location -- the riverfront was just across the street, and there were a number of good restaurants within easy walking distance. (Tip for art lovers: there's an extremely talented Haitian artist who sells paintings on River Street. His name is Jean Claude Martin, and his paintings are amazing.) The historic district of Savannah is worth seeing, and most of it is within an easy walk of this hotel -- even in the August heat. My husband's convention was a success, and I had a great time exploring Savannah.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Sept 13th and 14th, 2011. The location is in the heart of the historical area of SAV, and you can walk or trolley to anywhere. But what we found about the hotel to be most satisfying was the service, at check in we really didn't like our room location, went down to the front desk and Olga gladly set us up in another one over Bay St. that had a patio, at no extra charge or any hesitation. She was very sweet.
reviews.title: We had a good time....
Wonderful hotel & best breakfast ever!
reviews.text: We had planned on bar hopping through out the area, but once we met Becki in the hotels tavern, we did the majority of our drinking there, she was so helpful with tips on where to eat and things to see and do. She maintains a close knit personable atmosphere that's conducive to people getting to know each other, and your beverage never goes empty, she's truly an asset to that hotel, may want to keep her around.

Overall the hotel was very nice, rooms very comfy, breakfast was good and plentiful, and it has a great rooftop pool and hot-tub. Living in ATL now we will be frequent visitors to SAV and the H.I.E will be our choice for lodging. And if we're unable to book there, we'll for sure stop by and have beer with Becki.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: I recently attended a Georgia Science Teachers Conference in Savannah and picked this hotel from the list offered in the conference registration. We got the conference rate that the school paid for and it was a wonderful deal for all of us. This hotel is about a year old - not a remodel. It is clean, the beds are very comfortable and the staff was very friendly. We had a nice sized room with two queen beds with a window on Bay Street. The bathroom was large enough to actually turn around in! Two women had plenty of room for all our stuff! The breakfast included hot and cold items that are about the same as other Holiday Inn Express hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Walk out the door and you can walk across the street and down to the riverfront or just up and down Bay Street. Lots of good restaurants are close by. Downtown Savannah is all about walking and this hotel puts you right in the middle of it.
reviews.title: Great place to use as home for your stay in Savannah, Ga.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in charge of a church group of 14. We were handle great before we ever arrived. Julie and Jennifer had eeverything ready for us when we arrived. I even recieved the room numbers before hand and was able to give each person the room numbers of everyone. The breakfast was great, we did not use the bar but one is avaible. You are only a short walk to the Riverwalk which you could see from the hotel. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was nice. I would give it 10 stars if I could. The hotel is very close to resturants. You are with in walking distant to Paula Deen's, Myself I would suggest going to Mrs Wilkes instead the food is a lot better. They also suggested Mr. Tony to pick us up from the Amtrak Station. He was right on time, he had enough people to load the luggage. The hotel helped unload the luggage. I can't complainment them enough on the services they offered. The Hotel was within walking distant of many resturants. Your are within walking distant to Paula Deen's but I would suggest that you go first to Paula's and the next day to Mrs. Wilkes. Her food is so much better. They suggested us using Mr. Tony to pick us up from Amtrak Station he was on time to pick us up from Amtrak and on time to pick us up from the hotel and take us back to Amtrak station. Again I have to say It was one of the best hotel I ever stayed at. Thank you Julie and Jennifer. Make sure you go to the roof top swimming pool.
reviews.title: Savannah, and this hotel, were GREAT!

reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located to walk the wonderful streets of Savannah. We had a corner room which was incredible, with lots of windows and great views. Staff was very nice as well. We would not hesitate coming back!
reviews.title: awesome location awesome room awesome price

reviews.text: We came to Savannah for the first time on March 19, 2009. There were 6 of us women and we had requested connecting rooms. When we checked in that night around 10 p.m., we didn't have connecting rooms, but they discounted both of our rooms, that were already very reasonably priced. The hotel is very convenient, we walked everywhere, River Street, Market, Savannah Smiles, Paula Dean's and we felt very safe at even when returning at 3 a.m.
reviews.title: Service of a 5-star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The selection of this hotel was based on TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The location is at Bay and Abercorn, overlooking the river. The room was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast (included in the room price) was a good start to the day. Self-parking was next door at a city lot at the rate of $10/day. Savannah is a walking city with 20+ squares to explore. During our stay, we had several days when we needed the automobile, several where we just left it in the garage and walked. The staff was friendly and generous with directions and advice. One evening we came back to the hotel late trudging through a thunderstorm and one of the desk staff was in the lobby handing out towels. Just great. We had a room on the 8th floor with a view of the river. It was super. The bar in the lobby was fun with a garrulous bartender who made a party out of whoever was there. She is a total hoot.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great hotel, wonderful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in Sept. Booked a corner king with four windows. Very nice room. Was going to stay at Avia, but didn't find florida resident discount on their site and their rates went up since I had last looked. Holiday Inn is close to Avia but actually in a better location. I first went to visitor center and got a 48 hour parking pass, and after dropping off luggage parked car immediate next door in public parking building . Avoided higher charges from hotel. Also the fact that Holiday Inn offered a free breakfast, was added inducement over Avia. Bellboys were not very helpful when unloading, after I told them I would park the car myself. Further, I had read that there was free water which is kept in a cooler by the bellboys, however, there was no water there for two days. Instead, I went to a CVS 5 blocks away to buy water.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very clean and nice, and quite large. Ate dinner at the Pink House, which is about 100 yards away. Great meal. Took a walking tour with Savannah Dan, which is 4 short blocks away. I was concerned about safety in Savannah, but soon learned that Savannah was a college city, with students roaming about all over the historic district. Very Safe. Walked to and from a show at the Savannah Theatre, late at night and it was very safe. Great show. Will repeat. Loved the city.
reviews.title: Great staff....Especially Hope

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great 2 night stay. We were in a King, corner with a view. Room was big and loved the 4 windows. The shower was a nice size. This hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. Walking distance to just about everything. The staff was AWESOME. Hope goes out of her way to make sure everything is just right.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Recently enjoyed a 2 night stay here. Stayed in a Queen bed, corner room which was attractively decorated, clean and comfortable. The only possible drawback, was the complete lack of a view; our room faced the multistorey car park. This didn't bother us, although we did over hear another guest complaining to reception staff about this.
reviews.title: Becki needs raise!!!!

reviews.text: We (my husband, myself, and our 3 month old boy) stayed at Holiday Inn Express Savannah - Historic District weekend of August 9-11, 2011. We had a queen room with pull out sofa, mini fridge, microwave, wet bar sink. The room had nice bathroom but with only a shower. We reserved the Queen Feature Room. We were very pleased with the room as there was plenty of space in the living area to use our Pack N Play. When we got to our room the tv was not working properly, we called the front desk and within 5 minutes the maintenance guy was in the room replacing it with a brand new tv! The free breakfast was great. not your usual muffin and cold cereal although they did have these options. Breakfast included pancakes, eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits, gravy, cinnamon rolls and I can't even remember what else.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: Parking - valet was I think $15 a day but we used the city parking garage located directly behind the hotel.
reviews.title: Thanks Alfons

reviews.text: Very convenient to River Street and within walking distance to most of the downtown attractions.
reviews.title: Great location, nice clean rooms & friendly staff

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, good price

reviews.text: Only downside was the rooftop pool was closed for maintenance but that was understandable.
reviews.title: Great location, clean room, nice staff

reviews.text: We booked this hotel from Sunday March 14, to Wednesday, March 18 and were not disappointed. The location is great. You are at the corner of two of the most popular streets in Savannah: Bay St. and Abercorn St. The lobby is nice and well appointed. There is plenty of seating in the breakfast area and plenty of food at the continental breakfast every morning, though the warm choices were limited. No fresh eggs or pancakes/waffles. The room was nice with a goodf size bathroom. The beds were comfortable with four pillows on each bed. The only complaint we had was check out. We didn't realize that the best way to check out is to call from your room for the valet. We paid an extra $5 to valet part our car and went down with our luggage and had to wait at least twenty minutes for our car to be brought around. Then WE realized it was sititng out there. No one came and got us; we just saw it sitting there! That was irritating because we really don't know how long it sat there while we were twidding our thumbs. Overall, this is really the only complaint we had. Good location, great rooms, excellent security, and tasteful decorations.
reviews.title: Great location for St. Patrick's Day

reviews.text: We traveled here on our way to Daytona Beach Florida for Bike Week. Never have been to Savannah so we were looking forward to our short visit. I wish we had more than one day, would love to explore this great city. Hotel staff was wonderful and were very helpful. The only thing I can say about the rooms is that the carpet needed cleaning. The beds were very comfortable. We had a room that overlooked the river. This hotel is centrally located and you can walk to most activites and resturants. We will stay here again if we ever get a chance to get to Savannah.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, great location

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded all of our expectations. The entire staff always has a smile and couldn't be more helpful. The rooms are nice and extremely clean with comfortable beds, flat screen tv (with a lot of channels), lots of lights and nice, clean bathrooms, with hairdryers. Parking is right next door and very reasonable for downtown parking, charged directly to your room if you get your card stamped. I checked out the rooftop pool and was very pleased, though it was too cold to swim.
reviews.title: Great hotel, staff, location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price is almost unbelievable, considering the location, which is right in the historic district, with lots of restaurants, and right across the street from Riverwalk. It is safe to walk around, day and evening. Very nice shops all around.
reviews.title: Great location and value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is always good, kept hot and good selections. The coffee is always available and fresh.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: We have been to Savannah a few times and needed a place to overnight when we traveled on I-95. We decided to stay here after reading all the wonderful comments on Tripadvisor. The hotel is what it is; a Holiday Inn Express. Do not expect more. The location was amazing, and the parking garage next door was very convenient. The free breakfast was fine. If you have the chance, eat at Vic's On The River.
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location - Fine For One Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have traveled all over the country and this was one of our favorite hotels. The room was clean, large and homey. The staff was so friendly and helped us plan all of our days in Savannah, Hilton Head and Charleston. They even took the time to write up their recommendations and slip the document under our door while we went to dinner. The rooftop pool and deck overlooks the river and is beautiful to watch the sunset over the bridge. You have to pay for parking in the garage next door but its super close and very easy to get in and out of (or the hotel also has 24 hour valet) The breakfast area was large, spacious and the food was delicious. Lots of options, including a very cool automated pancake maker. The location is perfect for exploring the city and hitting restaurants, bars and shopping. Free WiFi was a great bonus too. We would stay here and recommend the Holiday Inn Express Savannah time and time again.
reviews.title: Would stay again and again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is in a great location and the rooms are quite comfortable,decent beds,nice flatscreen tv with all channels and a nice rooftop pool.the manager,alfonse was super accommodating,he upgraded us to a balcony room with a river view and put my husbands "happy birthday" on the lobby screen and bought us a couple of drinks.everyone had a big smile on their face and were very pleasant.if u r a light sleeper the rooms in front r kind of noisy as there r lots of trucks on bay st.
reviews.title: friendly hotel in friendly town

reviews.text: If you wish to be in a “classy” hotel in the downtown historic district of beautiful Savannah—at surprisingly reasonable prices—this is it…and here’s why: a terrific staff; large, quiet, lovely rooms; next-door parking; very short walking distance to the River Walk [restaurants, shops, entertainment], as well as the tour-bus stops; nearby parks, attractions, theaters—as well as the special sightseeing that makes this city so beckoning to visitors. I can’t think of anything that the hotel—or the historic district—could have offered that we didn’t gladly experience.
reviews.title: A great hotel in downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also stayed here based on Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel. Clean rooms, comfortable beds. Got a King Room in the corner with a view. Great view! (Although not the top floor that we'd requested as it was already "taken" when we arrived). Staff is helpful and accomodating. Had problems with the wifi, but was given a ethernet cord which helped with the connections.....would stay here again!!
reviews.title: Nice, clean and comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend visit to the historic Savannah area. The location was great - close to the river, historic houses, city squares and restaurants. Hotel was very well maintained and staff was attentive. We recommend several nearby restaurants - including The Olde Pink House, Vics on the River and Il Pasticcio. One of the Savannah walking tours started in a square that was only a block from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, clean hotel and friendly service

reviews.text: My husband & another couple friend stayed 2 nights here in April 2009 & it was an excellent choice, you will not be disappointed! Quite frankly, I was hesitant about staying in a Holiday Inn Express, I was hoping for something more "historic" and "quaint" like The Marshall House, but they didn't have availablity. I am glad we ended up here. The service was wonderful from the valet parking attendants, (Very nice people) to the people working behind the counter. We tried to check in about an hour early and were told a room was available, but if we wanted to wait & come back in about 2 hours they would have a room ready with a much better view. We decided to wait & it was worth it! The rooms were very nice & clean, (new) and the bathroom is larger than most. The rooftop pool & hot tub area is a nice touch. (pretty view too) One evening, we went downstairs to the bar & had a few drinks before dinner, the bartender was very friendly and gave us lots of tips of the area. Also the concierge was eager to help us in any way & gave us an excellent choice to go for breakfast one day. (even though they serve a continental breakfast at the hotel, it's your basic hotel free breakfast) You will love J. Christophers! It's actually an old fire department turned into a restaurant. YUM! Lastly, you will like the location of this hotel. It's right in the middle of the district and an easy hop across the street to River Street. You will be happily surprised by staying at this Holiday Inn Express! TIP: Ask for a room with a view.
reviews.title: Awesome Choice!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice new hotel - great service - good value! There was not one day that someone at the front desk didn't say good morning to us as we left and returned to the hotel. Also, front desk was also so calming during a recent tornado warning ( thankfully it didn't hit) that occurred while we were there - kudos for keeping your cool among the harried crowd! Housekeeping was superb - hotel is new and very clean. Beds were very comfy and cushy. This is certainly not your average Holiday Inn. Perks were that our stay came with a complimentary continental breakfast which was nice - and our room had a small fridge and microwave. Apparently the company that owns this property also owns the other hotel we stayed at for the first part of our trip, the Holiday Inn in Charleston SC, Historic District. Whatevery they are doing, they are doing it right! Both properties were awesome and deserve their high praises.
reviews.title: one word- PERFECT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, very stylish hotel and above average for a Holiday Inn Express. We had a great time here. Had a view of the parking garage. Wished our view could have been better though
reviews.title: Great location and above average for a Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: This is a great example of how a hotel should be run. All the staff were very friendly. Our room was comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the service and room was great! we had a coner room with a great view and ample space for setting and closet space was o.k.! the hotel is very clean and neat. the front desk (HOPE) valet parking(CARL) and the super lady in the lounge(BECKY) were just super!! we were in town for 4 nights and savannah is a great city and we cann't wait to get back and stay at the HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS.
reviews.title: best location and lounge in historic district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: betty and jack
reviews.title: This is a great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stopped here on a fly by the seats of our pants vacation. We arrived late and the people were so nice. Our room was great. It was very cleand and the employees of the hotel were very frinedly and helpful. The breakfast area was wonderful and had many choices. When we go back to Savannah, we will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: I will definitely be back to this property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This fairly new property is in a great location in Savannah's famous historic district. It is within walking distance of most everything downtown and River Street. My room was roomy, very comfortable, had a large closet and bath with a walk-in shower. The staff really went out of their way to make you feel welcome.
reviews.title: Great Location and Comfortable Room

reviews.text: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express-Historic District March 28 and 29 in Room 518 (corner view room with King bed). Hotel is very well laid out. Front desk staff is helpful and friendly. Room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. We especially liked the wet bar with small fridge and microwave. Nice flat screen TV. Plenty of drawer/desk space. Location is excellent. You are a short walk away from everything. We did not try the bar, but saw a lot of folks sitting there each evening. Breakfast is a disappointment...but OK for a "throw in." (some muffins, yogurt, coffee, tea, cereals and juices...cold sausage, biscuits and "hockey puck" pre-made omelets). Skip it and walk down the street to one of the local cafes. Much better. Also, a tip on the parking. Hotel parking is $10 a day, per day. Parking is located in a public building directly behind/beside the hotel. Weekend flat rate if paying yourself at the garage is $3 a day/entry versus $10 a day at the hotel. Weekday rates are $1.00 per hour...so if you're visiting on the weekend you can save money by paying for parking yourself instead of validating at the hotel. All in all, a quiet, clean hotel that I would recommend for a visit to Savannah. (Our rate was $199 a night.)
reviews.title: Best Place to stay!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Savannah-Historic District Hotel
description: Stay in the heart of the historic district and soak up the splendor that is Savannah. Next time your travels take you to Savannah, choose the brand new Holiday Inn Express Historic District. This contemporary Southern style property is located right on Bay St. and is surrounded by dozens of boutiques, restaurants, River Street and Savannah s famed squares. It features a graceful lobby, full service fireside lobby bar, a rooftop pool and gazebo and guest rooms equipped with flat screen TVs. Rates include deluxe continental breakfast and high speed internet access.
